etymologies: early 17th century (in the sense ‘bedbug’): from Spanish chinche, from Latin cimex, cimic-

definitions: a plant-eating ground bug that forms large swarms on grasses and rushes.

notes.text: Two species in the family Lygaeidae, suborder Heteroptera: the American Blissus leucopterus, which is a major pest of cereal crops, and the European Ischnodemus sabuleti

shortDefinitions: plant-eating ground bug that forms large swarms on grasses
